intro: Macrocarpaea glabra, commonly known as the smooth macrocarpa, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
